channel.title: Maximum build height
channel.description:
I want to make kami's lookout from dbz, on the official server. I could do an epic job if we were able to build higher. Is this possible or easy to change?
Right now my tower is pretty high. But not high enough for me to do the platform properly.

item.title: Maximum build height
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:9, topic:380640”][quote author=xryz link=topic=476466.msg3485390#msg3485390 date=1296517933]
if you found the varibles in the client couldn’t u like change it. then if there is a part in the server that you also have to change, change it.

or you could dig deep in the ground and extend it downward. so there would be hills surrounding it.
[/quote]

From bottom of the map (first layer of bedrock) to the maximum height is 255 blocks.[/quote]

If that is true, and it probably is, then it’s a limitation of minecraft (that can’t be changed easily/at all) in that it uses a byte to store location. The only way it could be changed is if it loaded up/down just like it loads the regions north/south/east/west. Definitely not a trivial change though, and probably useless.

Read full topic

item.title: Maximum build height
item.dc:creator: @Kono-chan Kono-chan
item.description:
@Kono-chan wrote:

Spades:

I am 90% sure there is no limitation on how high you can go. But, if you go too high you will be glitchy for other people, it will try to show you in the ground, so you will be waist deep in dirt/whatever it is you used to build. Because I have seen people go higher then you normally would go.

There is a limit, I’m sure most everyone has reached it before.

Read full topic

item.title: Maximum build height
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

There is a limit. I’ve tried it before.

Read full topic

I really think it’s a limitation of the client. You’ll probably just have to scale it down.
